taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family Asteraceae;tribe Heliantheae;subtribe Helianthinae;genus Helianthus;species eggertii;

bio:treatment.discussion: Helianthus eggertii is similar to H. strumosus and H. laevigatus; it is distinguished by the distinctive blue coloration of stems and leaves and by the leaves usually 1-nerved, in contrast to the 3-nerved condition typical for the genus. It is listed federally as an endangered species; R. L. Jones (1994) found it to be more common than was previously thought, and it is now in the process of being removed from the federal list.
